content.description:
O Danaum fortissime gentis 
TydideTydides, -ae, m.: Diomedes (a Greek warrior and the son of Tydeus)! Mene IliacisIliacus, -a, -um, adj. = Troianus, -a, -um occumbereoccumbo, -ere = cado, -ere campis 
non potuisse, tuaque animam hanc effundere dextra?
content.question: Which of the following stylistic devices occurs in line 2 (Tydide...campis)?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
